exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

category

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

description

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

film_set

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

id

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

Entertainment.utils module

Entertainment.utils.category_objects(request, category_name)[source]

Retrieves the category queryset from the database based on its category name.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object (optional, if needed).

  • category_name (str) – The name of the category.

Returns:

A queryset of objects for the specified category.

Return type:

QuerySet

Entertainment.utils.get_category_names(response: dict) → list[source]

Finds the question ID for the next question in the quiz.

Parameters:

response (list) – A list containing relevant information about the quiz.

Returns:

A dictionary with details about the next question (e.g., question ID, category).

Return type:

dict

Entertainment.utils.get_json_categories()[source]

Retrieve a specific category from the Open Trivia DB API.

Returns:

The JSON response from the Open Trivia DB API

Return type:

dict

Entertainment.utils.get_next_question_id(category_name, question_id, question_selection_pks)[source]

Retrieves the next question ID based on the current question ID and the list of question primary keys.

Parameters:

  • question_id (int) – The ID of the current question.

  • question_selection_pks (list) – A list of primary keys representing available questions.

Returns:

The ID of the next question.

Return type:

int

Entertainment.utils.get_specific_json_category(quantity: int, category: int) → dict[source]

Retrieve a specific category from the Open Trivia DB API.

Parameters:

name (str) – A description of the quantity and category.

Returns:

The JSON response from the Open Trivia DB API.

Return type:

dict

Entertainment.utils.mix_choices(choices: list) → list[source]

Mixes the choices for each question in a quiz.

Parameters:

choices (list) – A list of answer choices for a question.

Returns:

A shuffled list of choices.

Return type:

list

Entertainment.views module

Entertainment.views.detail(request, category_name, question_id)[source]

This function retrieves a question object from the database based on the question_id passed in the URL. It also retrieves the list of choices for the question and converts the choices text field into a list of dictionaries. The function passes all the context variables into a single dictionary to render in the template correctly.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object (optional, if needed).

  • category_name (str) – The name of the category.

  • question_id (int) – The ID of the question.

Returns:

The detail template.

Return type:

HTTPResponse

Entertainment.views.index_en(request)[source]

This function represents the homepage of Entertainment quizzes. It displays a list of categories of quizzes and the first question of each category. If a user prematurely leaves a quiz and does not use the exit button, the result and session data of the current quiz are deleted.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object (optional, if needed).

Returns:

The en_quiz template.

Return type:

HTTPResponse

Entertainment.views.results(request, category_name: str)[source]

This function retrieves the quiz result from the session and renders the result template.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object (optional, if needed).

  • category_name (str) – The name of the category.

Returns:

The result template.

Return type:

HTTPResponse

Entertainment.views.selection(request, category_name, question_id)[source]

Handles the submitted data for a question in a quiz.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object (optional, if needed).

  • category_name (str) – The name of the category.

  • question_id (int) – The ID of the question.

Returns:

The detail template.

Return type:

HTTPResponse

Entertainment.views.try_new_quiz(request)[source]

This function deletes the quiz result and session data of the current quiz before starting a new quiz. It then redirects the user to the home page of Entertainment quizzes.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object (optional, if needed).

Returns:

The index_en template.

Return type:

HTTPResponse
